name: Spicy Chicken Tacos
steps:
Cut chicken breast into thin strips and season with taco seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken strips and cook for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until fully cooked and slightly charred.
Remove chicken from heat and let rest for 2 minutes, then shred with two forks.
Warm corn tortillas one at a time in a dry skillet over medium heat for 30 seconds per side until pliable.
Keep tortillas warm by wrapping in a clean kitchen towel.
Prepare toppings: shred lettuce, dice tomatoes and red onion, chop cilantro.
To assemble tacos: place a warm tortilla on a plate, add shredded chicken, then top with lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, and cheese.
Drizzle with sour cream, add jalapeño slices if desired, and garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over tacos.
